title: Peer pressure: learning to be yourself
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Decision-making
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Teenage girls
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Peer pressure
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Conduct of life
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Teenage girls
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Brothers and sisters
description: A fifteen-year-old girl learn to understand how she allows peer pressure to affect her life. Insecure and hoping for acceptance, she acts accordingly to gain approval. Her older brother helps her recognize that she should be paying more attention to her own feelings when makng decissions. Defines and discusses the more subtle types of peer pressure.
